author: Liam Prenderville
title: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte insists Diego Costa's long-term future is at Stamford Bridge
text:
Conte believes Costa can fire Chelsea to the title (Photo: Darren Walsh) Share Get Chelsea FC   Could   
Antonio Conte believes Diego Costa will be at Chelsea for years to come. 
The Spain striker has been linked with a move away from Stamford Bridge after a training ground row with boss Conte. 
He was left out of the squad to play Leicester last month before returning to the fold. 
Last week, Conte revealed he did lose his cool with his talisman before insisting 'everything is perfect' between the pair. 
And ahead of this weekend's clash with Burnley, the Blues boss tipped the striker to stay put for the foreseeable future. Conte and Costa celebrate (Photo: Clive Rose) Costa has had an excellent season with Chelsea (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
"Diego is a really important player. The situation is very clear," he told the BBC'S Premier League show. 
"He’s very happy to stay with us, he’s very happy to fight for the title." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
